questions.title: Basic Operating Profit Margin
questions.question: A farmer receives a gross farm income of $[B1] and incurs operating expenses of $[B2]. What is his operating profit margin?

questions.title: Advanced Operating Profit Margin
questions.question: A farmer receives a total income of $[B1], which includes a loss from rental properties of $[B2]. The net profit for the business is $[B4]. Expenses on interest & rent are $[B5] & $[B6] respectively. Given that the value of unpaid family labour and management is $[B7]. What is his operating profit margin ?

questions.title: Basic Asset Turnover Ratio
questions.question: A farmer receives a gross farm income of $[B1]. The total assets of his business at opening is $[B2]. What is the asset turnover ratio for the business?

questions.title: Advanced Asset Turnover Ratio
questions.question: A farmer receives a gross farm income of $[B1]. The total liabilities & equity of the business are $[B2] & $[B3] respectively.  What is the asset turnover ratio for the business?

questions.title: Return on Assets
questions.question: A farmer receives a gross farm income of $[B1] and incurs operating expenses of $[B2]. His expenses on rent are $[B4]. The total assets of the business is $[B5]. What is the return on asset for this business?

questions.title: Basic Return on Equity
questions.question: A farmer receives a gross farm income of $[B1] and incurs operating expenses of $[B2]. His expenses on interest & rent are $[B4] & $[B5] respectively. The equity of the business is $[B6]. What is the return on equity for this business?

questions.title: Advanced Return on Equity
questions.question: A farmer receives a total income of $[B1], which includes a loss from rental properties of $[B2]. The net profit for the business is $[B4]. Expenses on interest & rent are $[B6] & $[B7] respectively. The value of unpaid family labour and management is $[B8]. The total assets & total liabilities of the business are $[B11] & $[B12] respectively. What is his return on equity for this farm?

questions.title: Basic Cost of Production
questions.question: A lamb enterprise incurs $[B2] in variable operating costs & $[B3] in fixed costs. Income from by-products wool sale & ewe sale is $[B4] and $31800 respectively. The total weight of lamb sold is [B6] kg equivalent carcass weight. What is the cost of production for the lambs? In additon to this the beef enterprise is based around the weaners being sold store. The beef enterprise incurs $[C2] variable operating costs $[C3] fixed costs, and cow income of $[C4]. Total weaner weight is $[C6] What is the Cost of production?

questions.title: Advanced Cost of Production
questions.question: A [B1] ha sheep & beef enterprise has a going concern value of [B2]. The total operating expenses are [B3] of which [B4] are fixed operating expenses. [B5] of the DM is consumed by the sheep enterprise. The sheep enterprise incurs [B10] in variable operating costs & receives income from by-products wool sale & ewe sale is [B12] and [B13] respectively. The total weight of lamb sold is [B15] kg equivalent carcass weight.  Given a cost of capital of [B7]%, what is the cost of production?

questions.title: Current Ratio
questions.question: A farmer has [B1] of Current Assets made up of Cash investments, accounts receivable and livestock. Current Liabilites are [B2] made up of Overdraft, and Accounts payable. What is this businesses Current Ratio?

questions.title: Lambing %
questions.question: A farmer lambs [B1] ewes. Looking through his records you see he sold 250 ewes as scanned dry and culled a further 100 at scanning. A closer look also highlights the number retained from scanning was 5,100. He docked 7675 lambs. What is his lambing percentage?

questions.title: Calving %
questions.question: A farmer calves 450 cows. Looking through his records you see he sold [B3] cows as scanned dry and culled a further 50 at scanning. A closer look also highlights the number retained from scanning was [B1]. He docked [B5] calves. What is his calving percentage?

questions.title: Weaning weight calves
questions.question: Two farmers wean their calves in Autumn. Farmer A weans his calves at [B4] days of age (average) at an average weight of [B2]. Birthweight of the calves is [B3]. Farmer B weans his calves at an average of [C2] kg at [C4] days of age. Birthweight of the calves is [C3]. What is the 200 day adjusted weight of the calves?

questions.title: Weaning weight lambs
questions.question: Two farmers wean their lambs in Summer. Farmer A weans his lambs at [B4] days of age (average) at an average weight of [B2]. Birthweight of the lambs is [B3]. Farmer B weans his lambs at an average of [B2] at [B4] days of age. Birthweight of the calves is [B3]. What is the 90 days adjusted weight of the two mobs

questions.title: Flock replacements ratio
questions.question: A farmer mates [B1] ewes. He retains [B2] ewe hoggets as replacements. What is his replacement percentage?

questions.title: Herd replacements ratio
questions.question: A farmer mates [B1] cows and heifers. He retains [B2] Heifer calves as replacements. What is his replacement percentage?

questions.title: Fibre production per Hectare
questions.question: A farmer produces [B4] of wool per annum. With a sheep:cattle ratio of [B3]:[B4] what is the wool production per sheep hectare and total hectare if the property is [B1] hectares?

questions.title: Liveweight per ha

questions.title: MS/ha

questions.title: Beef and Lamb Basic
